item.description:
If you say it with acrylic, you make it crystal clear that you're modern and chic.

  • New York, NY: Waterfall Coffee Table - $375
  • Minneapolis, MN: Astrolite Bookends - $310

item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: 6 Ways to Equip Your Camera for Safe Outdoor Use
item.description:
Now that the weather is warming up, you'll undoubtedly be doing more outside, which means more moments to capture out under the sun, in the wind, or even underwater. Whether you're shooting with a DSLR or prefer to use a smartphone for photos, here are a few photography options that will let you capture your most memorable moments without the worry of damaging your device.

More
item.author: Julienne Lin

item.title: How To Baby Proof Your Rental — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Uh-oh. Has that baby of mine really worked out how to get in the refrigerator? Already? And the cabinets? Time to baby proof our rental. But how, when there is so little we can change? Here are a few of the challenges us renters face when baby-proofing, and the simple steps we can take to overcome them.
More
item.author: Alison Gerber

item.title: 3 Online Collage Tools for Creating Magazine-Style Layouts
item.description:
Fashion magazines create such a distinct look with their photo spreads: white backgrounds, with artfully arranged pieces that fit a particular theme, each one numbered clearly, with a key at the bottom describing the item, its provenance, and its cost. You know them when you see them, and they're much more attractive to look at than the endless cascade of rectangles that you might see on a fashion-themed Pinterest board.

More
item.author: Rachel Rosmarin

item.title: Brooke's Campout Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Brooke
Location:
London Canada
Division:
International
What do you love about your bedroom?:
Our son Henry Fleetwood's bedroom is what we call the Fleet''woods" in the house. We placed Norfolk pines around the tepee to create a fun, imaginary forest for him to camp out in. His room faces south, so it is flooded with natural light all day long, but dark enough when the curtains are drawn for a cozy nap under the light of his moon.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Tip: Store Grated Ginger in the Freezer
item.description:
I have a little ritual when I bring fresh ginger home from the market: peel, grate, freeze. Not only is this a great way to keep ginger fresh longer, but it becomes incredibly easy to punch up a sauce, stir fry, or smoothie any time you want some gingery spice. 

• Grated Ginger in the Freezer
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Find Your Favorites: Monday's Entries — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
We're entering the home stretch of our Bedroom Contest. This is the last week for posting new entries. Check out today's entries and if you like what you see, be sure to click the heart on their post to make them a "favorite" and help move them up on the leaderboard.

  • Rachel's Heirloom History Bedroom
  • Katie's Quotable Bedroom
  • Brit's Renovated Space Bedroom

item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: White Wall Solutions: Rooms with Texture — RENTERS SOLUTIONS
item.description:
All white walls provide a neutral backdrop that lends itself well to introducing texture.  Unlike pattern and color, which often make a bold statement, texture may not be quite as obvious, but can still make just as big of an impact.  Texture can add dimension to a room, create harmony between different elements, or serve as a focal point.  Consciously adding and playing with  texture — especially layered and contrasting textures — can be a quick way to transform any room, especially those rentals with stark white walls.

More
item.author: Kimber Watson

item.title: Ken's Breakfast in Bed Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Ken
Location:
Los Angeles, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
The first thing I see when waking up is a wall full of my favorite art and my beautiful boyfriend. I also love the subdued color palette and the warm soft lighting. Dimmers on everything!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Felecie's Childhood Memories Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Felecie
Location:
Houston, TX
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love the natural light and old original 1950's hardwood floors. This home is the home I grew up in. When my parents moved away and I moved away they never sold it. I love that I can come back and make it special on my own but still have all the wonderful childhood memories and even some of the same neighbors!


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Next Month in Milan: EDIT by Design Junction
item.description:
A sneak preview of the soaring space for EDIT by Design Junction 2013 in Milan.

Next month, I'll be packing my camera and laptop and heading to Milan for one of the biggest weeks of the year for international design. Designers, retailers, manufacturers and (very lucky) press people will be heading to the Fiera for the Salone Internazionale del Mobile. But those in the know will also be heading to La Pelota on Via Palermo, for a fresh take on what's next - Design Junction's festival within a festival, EDIT.

More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: The Home That Got Away
item.description:
Do you dream of the home you wanted but weren't able to get? Do you miss a home you once lived in? Whether it's a place that's no longer right for your needs, is out of your price range, or was snapped up by someone else, many of us have homes that haunt us. 

More
item.author: Rachael Grad

item.title: Best Kids Parties: Chocolate Fountain — My Party
item.description:
Name: 4 Year Old Boy
Location: Germany

Anyone who knows my son knows that chocolate is one of his favorite things in the whole world. Well, cars, keys, phones, and anything with buttons to push. And chocolate. Birthdays are supposed to be about favorite things, right? So a chocolate party it had to be. 
More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Clean Your Copper with Salt and Ketchup!
item.description:
I actually don't care for shiny copper, but occasionally the few pieces I have need a little cleaning up, so I was fascinated to read an article on the Kaufmann Mercantile website that recommends two very unexpected ingredients to clean copper...

item.title: Kara's Great Escape Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Kara
Location:
Cranford, NJ
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
After my great escape from a dark and dreary basement apartment, I love how bright and cozy my bedroom is now. My apartment has high ceilings and huge windows that let in tons of natural light. It's such a pleasant room to come home to after a long day.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Using Art for Interior Inspiration
item.description:
Artwork has the power to evoke emotion, as do the spaces in which we live. Your home is your own blank canvas for design and an opportunity to play with form, shape and color to produce a feeling. 

More
item.author: Lindsay Tella

item.title: New Takes on Old Paint Techniques — Renters Solutions
item.description:
When I think of paint treatments for walls, I automatically think of yellow-y brown paint, faux Tuscan facades (complete with crumbling "plaster" to reveal "brick" underneath), and really bad splotchy sponge paint. Yeesh, the 1980s and 1990s were rough. In search of big impact, low commitment rental solutions, I set out to find ways to mess around with paint — things that were both easily reversible, and that look like they belong in this decade. Here's what I found:

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: 5 Easy Garden DIYs with Pallets
item.description: Pallet wood is always great, because it's always cheap. If you're planning out a new look for your garden or deck this spring, it's a great choice for DIY projects, from playhouses to potting tables. More
item.author: Kathleen Luttschyn

item.title: Jana's Flowers on the Nightstand Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Jana
Location:
Charleston, SC
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love everything about our bedroom. The bed and nightstands were made by my boyfriend. The L shape of the room makes it possible to have one side clean, even if the dirty laundry has taken over the closet. There is great light, so my plants have a home inside during the winter. Most of my personal photographs and meaningful items are in the bedroom, which always makes me smile.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Rosa's Stylish Collection Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:

Name:
Rosa
Location:
San Francisco, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
My bedroom is a collection of objects and pieces that my partner and I have found, repurposed or made ourselves. I love our bedroom because there is a certain feeling, reason and memory attached to each item in it.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Robert's Keep It Simple Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Robert
Location:
New York, NY
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
Even though we live in the city, and our fourth floor bedroom windows overlook the street, somehow our bedroom is very peaceful and quiet. From a design standpoint, it is a simple canvas - with neutral colors similar to the walls in the adjoining master bath; this canvas brings the two spaces together creating a sense of unity between the rooms. Year-round full afternoon sunlight creating shadows through the beautiful windows are a favorite aspect of our bedroom for sure. The fireplace adds a dramatic effect, and provides a perfect sleeping alcove for our dog! Last, amidst the walnut mid-century inspired furniture, we use comfortable, warm and soft bedding in warm greys which grounds the room and makes the bed the focal point.


More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: One Minute Tip: Sorting 101! — Apartment Therapy Videos
item.description: Don't know where to start with that pile of stuff in your bedroom? Fay Wolf is here to help you get started with today's One Minute Tip. More

item.title: Rental Roundup: Our Best Tips — Renters Solutions
item.description:
Since this month is focused on renting and all that comes with it, I thought I would compile a list of our best rental tips in one bookmarkable place for you to keep at close reach.

item.author: Alysha Findley

item.title: How to Make the Most of Wall-to-Wall Carpet — Renters Solutions
item.description:
For reasons aesthetic and practical, I am not a fan of carpeting. Unfortunately for me and many people, wall-to-wall carpeting is a common feature of rental units. Here are a few ways to make the best of a shaggy situation.

More
item.author: Kim Rinehimer

item.title: Elizabeth's Elegant Nest Bedroom — My Bedroom Retreat Contest
item.description:
Like this My Bedroom Retreat contest entry? Favorite it below!
Name:
Elizabeth
Location:
San Francisco, CA
Division:
United States
What do you love about your bedroom?:
I love that our bedroom is downstairs. It is cozy and we call it the nest. The layering of textures and objects is easily rearranged and I love the muted palette that is so texturally based except for the color splurge on the wallpaper. The lighting was something that I was going to rewire for outside but we needed some lights that wouldn't take up key nightstand real estate. I fixed one to have a muted screen instead of the 1970s avocado green and it works. His and her lamps!


More
item.author: Jason Loper
